main event: An observer in Clovis, New Mexico, reported seeing a cigar-shaped object with the color of red-white flames flying through the sky on July 8, 1966.
interesting points: The object was observed for one minute and was flying with its long axis parallel to the ground., The altitude of the object was reported to be about 30,000 feet., The observer described the object following a course from SE to NW., There was inconsistency in the exhaust, which was about five times the length of the object., The sighting occurred during a clear star-filled night with thunderstorms in the distance.
witness description: Douglas F. Hillard, A2C, 27th FMS, Aircraft Mechanic, reliable observer.
